notes.text:
The web server on SIMATIC S7-1200 CPU V2/V3 Before V3.0.2 contains a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability that could allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted URI.

Siemens has released a new version for SIMATIC S7-1200 CPU V3 family (incl. SIPLUS variants) and recommends to update to the latest version. Siemens recommends specific countermeasures for products where fixes are not, or not yet available.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.
Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
notes.title: General Recommendations

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories

remediations.details: Disable JavaScript within the web browser used to access the web server of the affected products
Utilize a modern web browser with integrated XSS filtering mechanisms
Deactivate the web server if not required. The web server is disabled by default.
Update to V3.0.2 or later version
